subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Grouping/Partitioning
msgSnippet: ... Yes, but regular strings do have the advantage of arbitrary expressibility, whereas ClassNamesHaveToLookLikeThisWhichSucks. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger ::
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:

> On 7/12/07, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...
> <mailto:cbeust%40google.com>> wrote:
> > Interesting thought, but an advantage of string groups is that you can
> > run your tests by specifying group regexps (very powerful).
>
> Regular expressions work on class names, right?

Yes, but regular strings do have the advantage of arbitrary
expressibility, whereas ClassNamesHaveToLookLikeThisWhichSucks.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
